alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 25 at 5:11PM CDT until June 25 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana... West central Hancock County in southern Mississippi... South central Pearl River County in southern Mississippi... * Until 600 PM CDT. * At 510 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Pearl River, or 7 miles southwest of Picayune, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Slidell, Pearl River, Lacombe and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 261 and 270. Interstate 12 between mile markers 73 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 2. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
